title: language: cannot use z (type Z) as type A in function argument, when the types are indeed the same
body:
by **ecbtln**: 
What does 'go version' print?
go version go1.2 darwin/amd64

What steps reproduce the problem?
see below

If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.

http://play.golang.org/p/lg6BM_mRic

What happened?

Line 15 the compiler throws an error

What should have happened instead?

since the structs are type'd to the same object, they should be able to be used
interchangeably. Instead, a clunk interface{} conversion is needed to accomplish the
same goal, as in lines 17-18

Please provide any additional information below.
